title: So-called Early Christian Basilica
description: A small basilica located outside the walls of the ancient Greek city of Akragas, at the foot of the so-called Temple of Juno, on the eastern slopes of the Hill of the Temples, in an area previously occupied by the necropolis of the late Roman period.

properties.description: Representative location of the ruins of the so-called Early Christian Basilica, at the foot of the Temple of Juno, on the eastern slope of Agrigentum's Hill of Temples. Based on OpenStreetMap.
properties.title: OSM location of Basilica Paleocristiana
